dialog: Two of the horses run off, but that pinto you're riding hung around.
You got no idea what they were after?
They jumped you out of the blue?
I had to get up anyway.
Me, I'm riding along minding my own business.
Four cowboys come by, and we decide to ride together. Friendly as can be.
I figure you should approach life like everybody's your friend or nobody is.
Suddenly everybody's pointing their gun but me.
Looks like that's not all they admired.
I don't care much about the rest...
but I surely will miss that bay.
At least they didn't kill me.
That was right considerate, I thought.
They were laughing when they left me.
I walked for a little while, but it was no use so I gave it up.
Figured it was just bad luck.
Looks like those boys are headed south...
so they weren't the same ones that jumped me.
I'll get these horses tended to.
Just a minute. When I'm done helping the lady, I'll come here...
What can I get for that?
He claims the animal was stolen.
How do I know this is your horse?
Can't you see this horse loves me?
I had a gal do that to me.
It didn't make her my wife.
On the underside of that saddle I got my name scratched.
Take a look and you'll see.
And what would your name be?
Troopers, let's take a look at this saddle.
Get these children out of here.
And you, get some clothes on.
I see you've been prospering without me.
I've got a legitimate job now.
I could use a guy like you.
Yes, sir, you wouldn't believe it.
I think I finally found my place in the world.
But I think I'll just keep looking for mine.
I invited Paden to join us...
The only thing I lost I really cared about...
Black with a pretty silver band on it.
My head spent three years training it.
Yeah. I gotta stop off there, meet a guy. Head out for Silverado.
You're late, and I tell you I don't like it. It's a bad start.
I got my people down there throwing snowballs and rearing to go!
I'm afraid it is a bad start, friend.
My name ain't Baxter. He ain't Hawley.
Where the hell is Baxter and Hawley?
You're late. It's a bad start.
Yes. That means we'II have to get you to Silverado that much quicker.
You remember my letter, don't you?
Half now and half when we get there.
Don't you even want to count it?
Let's get this wagon train to Silverado.
I haven't had a whiskey or slept in a bed in ten days.
Hey, what are you doing, buck?
I haven't had a whiskey or slept in a bed in ten days.
I'm real sorry to hear that.
This nigger's breaking up my place, Sheriff Langston.
I don't like that word much, Carter.
We don't serve them here and you know it.
I asked him to leave and he went crazy on us!
Now he owes me money for this damage.
These other fellas started the ruckus.
I wanted a drink and a bed.
Guess I came to the wrong place.
I don't tolerate this. It's hard on the peace and the furniture.
Knowing a bit about Carter, I'll let you go without paying for the damage.
But go you will, and I mean now.
Is there a place in town that takes my kind?
I want you out of town.
In fact, I want you all the way out of my jurisdiction.
I decide what's right in this jurisdiction. Now move.
Who's gonna pay for this, Sheriff?
Now, let's talk about you chaps.
As you may have guessed, I am not from these parts.
But the good citizens of Turley have taken me in their embrace...
and for one simple reason: I maintain the peace.
So, when strangers come to town, I always ask them their business.
Have you come for the hanging?
I'm just meeting a guy here and moving on.
So far I haven't been able to find him.
In my town, if you're looking for someone, you ask me.
All right. He's a young fella, full of juice, about my size...
I know where that gentleman is.
I want everyone to behave himself.
I think we ought to just get out of here.
All I did was kiss a girl.
That's why they got you in jail?
so we had some words so I decided to get outta there.
So I walked out into the street.
He tries to shoot me in the back.
No, I winged him and he dropped his gun.
You're in here for winging a guy?
No, not exactly, because then his friend opened up on me.
Honest to God, he would've killed me.
He's the guy you're gonna hang?
You know what they did to me.
Blind Pete always said you'd hang.
I guess tomorrow at dawn, he'll be proved right.
Right. I always thought they did it at dawn.
I hate to see any man swing.
I gotta bust him outta there.
You'll have to deal me out on that.
I've had some experience with that sort of thing.
It's not going to be easy.
but first we're stopping off in Silverado, see our sister, say goodbye.
I can't show up there with a story like this.
I guess this is where we part ways.
Come on, I'll buy you a drink.
You know, a good, smelly saloon...
is my favorite place in the world.
What else you got that's mine?
Mister, I don't know what you're talking about.
I hope your fingers aren't tickling my ivoryhandled colt.
If you stand up slow and let me see, you might live through this night.
You mean you ain't coming with Emmett and me?
I can't say I'm convinced you're going anywhere.
I have no reason to run.
It was a fair fight and there were plenty of witnesses.
Yeah, that's what happened with me, too.
Blind Pete used to do this all by...
This is the only way out.
I woke up and he was gone.
All right, kid, come on out.
Thanks for giving me a hand.
Here's a trick for you, kid.
No, it's coming from those rocks.
Let's go. He ain't hitting nothing.
He's hit everything he's aimed at.
They won't be out of our jurisdiction until they pass Flat Top.
A guy who got run out of town.
Hobart, what are you people doing here?
Baxter and Hawley killed poor Eb and stole the money box.
You gotta get these people outta here.
No place to be setting with women and kids.
The next water ain't for three days.
We got no life without that money.
Jake, you know the way outta here.
Get this train moving to Silverado fast.
You men, stay with your wagons and your families.
Get rolling, keep your eyes peeled.
Even if you do get the money, how do we know you'II come back?
If we don't, you can keep my brother.
I don't plan on letting these men out of my sight.
If I brought a pretty lady like that into a place like this, I'd stay close.
Maybe I better stay here with her.
Let's get turned around and get these wagons rolling!
Hanging around with you is no picnic.
You really did it this time, Nord.
Should I kill him, Mr. Dawson?
I wouldn't do that. You're gonna need every gun when that posse gets here.
Posse? What the hell are you talking about?
Me and my partner robbed a bank. We headed out with a posse on our tails.
My partner caught one. He kicked off while I was looking for this canyon.
You're Dawson, ain't you? Tex LaRue.
I rode with Ry Morris. You know him.
Simms told me there's a hideout here so I headed for it. Hope you don't mind.
You brought a posse to my best hideout and you ask me if I mind?
Mister, I don't know any of those names.
Hold on! You don't believe me, ask them two there.
They saw me and my pal in Turley before we did the job.
I seen him there all right.
Don't know nothing about any bank job.
If you took the bank in Turley, where's the money?
I'd get down if I were you.
They might be up there right now.
I ain't getting out in the open to get it.
If we charge them, they won't stand a chance. We gotta get to the horses!
I think there's only a couple of guys up there and this asshole's one of 'em.
Keep him from getting the horses!
That was some idea of yours.
Put that box on my horse.
Mister, you got a lot to learn about people.
They got a place south of Silverado.
Good enough, anyway, so when my mama wrote me last time...
she said they needed my help to work the place.
That was almost nine months ago she wrote.
Letter took a while to find me, but when it did it was just the right time.
Geez, Paden, her old man ain't even cold yet.
The bank is soft on the other side.
My mama told me to head through that notch.
Maybe we'll see you around sometime.
Hope to see you again, ma'am.
I'll ride along with the lady.
Take a look at this farmland before I come into Silverado.
See what makes a trip this hard worth taking.
Mr. And Mrs. Parker have agreed to join their parcel to mine.
A lot of men have told me that.
I guess some women are slow to believe it.
They're drawn to me by that, but it never lasts.
Because they don't like what I want.
That's not why a man comes to a pretty woman.
After a while, I won't be so pretty...
It's good to be home, Kate.
I thought maybe Rae had come back to see me.
I never thought it'd be my boy.
She was sick a long time.
She was sick when she wrote you.
I never thought you'd come back, but she did.
Made it so I couldn't do...
I paid the government for it.
That don't mean much out here.
Malachi, I'm living like a wildcat in a cave in them hills.
Afraid to walk my own land.
Whose law? The law here runs a man down just like these cattle.
I had enough of what ain't right.
What we got here is a bad situation.
Those homesteaders you brought in are gonna make it worse.
When they come to stake their claims, it's gonna be the start of big trouble.
Gonna cut McKendrick off in the north.
A man could die of thirst before anybody offered him a drink around here.
Maybe you oughta come to California with Jake and me.
There's nothing wrong with the land.
It's just some of the people.
The problem is, Emmett, you killed the wrong McKendrick.
Watch what you're saying around Augie.
Well, it was selfdefense sure enough.
But I do think you'd have to say I killed old Murdo.
I think that's definitely the word.
The son is worse than the old man. He's smoother so you don't hear him coming.
He'll do anything to keep his range free.
I'm worried what he's gonna do when he finds out you boys are back.
I think Jake here can take care of himself.
I just did five years I didn't owe.
McKendrick oughta be satisfied with that and let it lie.
What brings you out of your hole, Johnson?
You got it all wrong, mister.
Mr. McKendrick bought this place from your father.
Tomorrow we're going to town and straighten that out once and for all.
The next day we'll be back here farming.
And them cattle better be gone.
If I find any cattle on our land after tomorrow...
I'm gonna start carving 'em into steaks.
And believe me, that's one thing I know about.
Killing cattle is a hanging offense in these parts.
If we shot you down right now, we'd be within our rights.
You ever seen what a Henry rifle can do in the hands of an expert?
This ain't the end of it.
What can I do you for, stranger?
The world is what you make of it.
If it doesn't fit, you make alterations.
Are you the Midnight Star herself?
I am. I'm always there, but I only shine at night.
This is what I call a saloon.
Thanks. That's what I call it, too.
And I know what I'm talking about.
It's the only place I'm happy.
You wouldn't be needing any help around here, say, with the gambling?
See that fellow playing with his hair?
Yeah. Apart from being a loudmouthed, lying cheat...
he's just the man I would've picked.
Why'd you go into business with him?
The man who does, stuck me with Kelly.
Two of my favorite people in the world talking to each other.
Stella, this is one of my oldest surviving friends.
You two are gonna get along just fine.
You got a lot in common. Kelly!
You didn't come all this way just to pay me back that money, did you?
Give the man a line of credit.
He already owes the house 13 bucks.
You got a place to stay?
We still got that extra room out back?
It's not in use at the moment.
What brings you to my saloon?
I was hoping maybe you'd changed your mind about the job.
You didn't tell me you owned a saloon.
That ain't the half of it, friend.
Our orders are to run you two out of here.
You couldn't leave well enough alone, could you, old man?
You tell us where your son is.
There don't have to be any shooting.
My son's on the way to town.
You're just gonna have to go by yourself.
But she's got a hard idea for living.
All I'm saying is you won't trip over me if you look her up.
I'm going to California with my brother.
Cobb, I want you to meet Emmett.
The pleasure's mine. Always happy to meet a friend of Paden's.
Stella, bring Kelly out here, will you?
You're the one who killed old Murdo McKendrick.
I didn't have much choice. He was about to shoot my brother in the back.
Can't be having that now, can we?
Kelly, we're gonna make an adjustment.
I wanted you to be here when I offered Paden your job.
I think he could do it without getting greedy.
Stella and I are tired of you skimming our profits.
I see you're an understanding boss.
Nothing like that would ever happen between us.
I never enjoy killing a man.
Excuse me. Sheriff, I'm a gambler who'd like to run an honest game here.
To whom do I speak about that?
I hope it's not this gentleman.
I better find somebody to clean up this mess.
You used to ride with that guy?
I told you to practice on a horse that's not moving, huh?
I got things to do, kid.
A grown man can't have a little boy with him everywhere he goes.
I thought you were done with our family.
I'm not sure, but I've got an idea.
When I'm sure, they gonna pay.
Where were you when Mama and Daddy needed you? It's too late, Mal.
Now you finally show up, and all you can think is to get yourself killed.
He used to be my brother.
But my mother called me "Slick." Excuse me.
Why are you here? This ain't for you.
Rae, all we got is each other.
I don't have any family anymore.
I'm surprised to see you out here today.
Just come out to say goodbye.
Yeah. Jake and me will be heading out for California soon.
You came all the way out here just to tell me you're going to California?
All you had to do was go.
We'd never see each other again.
You don't make it easy on a fella.
Maybe you thought you'd be back this way someday.
I'm saving lives here. Straight stuff would raise a blister on boot leather.
I meant it seemed like a lot of whiskey.
May it last a long time.
Nothing happened. This is my job.
I don't believe a lady has to explain anything to a man this ugly.
All I did was kiss the girl.
That's what you said in Turley.
What's the matter? You afraid I couldn't get those two behind me?
I don't want you gettin' anybody in my place.
I should've killed you a long time ago.
I just lost a partner. If you kill him, I'll never get anyone to work in here.
You really are a gambler, aren't you?
Give me some of the good stuff.
I didn't know you were out.
That's all over with as far as I'm concerned. I'm satisfied.
The man who lost this horse must've been working for you.
A lot of things changed when my father died.
That's why you've gotta take care of it.
Things are gettin' messy around here.
I hear Ezra Johnson got himself killed.
Did you hear his son is still around?
Cobb, looks like you're finally gonna earn your money.
From what I've seen, Paden doesn't care about money.
He says he doesn't care about anything, but he does.
There's just no tellin' what it's gonna be.
Let me tell you about your friend Paden.
Me, him, Tyree and a few others...
did a good bit of riding together a few years back.
We were movin' around a lot the way you have to in that line of work.
Somewhere along the line we picked up this dog.
One of the boys took to feedin' it, so it followed us everywhere.
One time we were leaving a little Missouri town...
with a bunch of locals hot on our tail.
This dog got tangled up with Tyree's horse.
Tyree was mad, and being Tyree...
Before you know it, Paden is off his horse...
He got strange, said we should go on without him.
I thought he was kidding, but he wasn't.
Tyree was ready to plug 'em both.
All this with a posse after us.
I thought we were pals after all the ridin' we'd done together.
All of a sudden he's worried about some mutt.
We did like he asked and we left him.
He went to jail for a dog.
You want to hear the funny part?
Paden didn't even like that damn dog.
It evened out in the end.
This is a lot of money.
I told you this was a sweet setup.
Maybe you could run it without Stella.
Paden, what makes all this work...
Those fellows you come to town with are causing some trouble.
It's gonna take some straightening out.
I want you to understand it has nothing to do with us.
What is it you want from me?
I'm a great believer in doing nothin'.
If you're taking on Emmett, the last place I want to be is between you.
Cobb said he'd be hard to kill.
I guess you couldn't hear us comin'.
He was practicing so hard for a fight...
I don't wanna kill you and you don't wanna be dead.
I think we should do like he says.
I'd be a lot worse if you hadn't come along.
Jake said you were out there.
He told me about that business the other day.
He said you boys took a Henry rifle...
The man who killed him took it.
I gotta get to my brother. They come after me, they'll want him, too.
Augie, I've had enough of this.
Kiss your father and get in bed.
We have nothing to talk about.
The men who killed Daddy are after Jake.
They're watching. I can't get through.
What makes you think I could?
He ain't in the saloon, either.
Jake said he'd meet you behind the church.
You must be Ezra Johnson's boy.
We're gonna give you a fair trial...
Or you could ride out of here before dawn.
You just have to tell me where I can find your friend Emmett.
I got there just short of too late.
You're working for Cobb these days, aren't you?
Your friends have been beating me to find that out.
You think I'm just gonna tell you?
You can go out the same way.
Me they figure to carry out.
He won't give them what they want.
Jake's been with me all evening.
Even after Slick came to get him?
The land office is on fire!
You go around the back of the house.
Wyoming, you go over there and help out.
Tom, you help with the buckets, too.
I hate to see this kind of thing in my town.
Gonna have to look into this.
I thought we talked about that.
They took the little boy, Cobb.
You're still worried about the dog, aren't you?
You've gotta calm down. Everything will be put straight in a few days.
Yeah. I saw how you put Mal Johnson straight.
Never could count on you to be reasonable.
Don't force me to make an adjustment around here.
Cobb, you got nothing I need.
I'm not thinking about your future, Paden.
What's she got to do with this?
But if you wind up on the wrong side of this...
I'm trying to save you from yourself.
What is it that I can't figure?
Cobb's got something on you and it must be pretty good.
If he didn't, you'd never sit still with all this going on.
Maybe that's the kind of friend I am.
Cobb says there's no tellin' what you're gonna care about.
He figured it okay this time.
I've only got one good hand.
Cobb's using me to stop you.
Good people are being hurt because of me.
Some people think because they're stronger or meaner...
I've seen a lot of that.
But it's only true if you let it be.
The world's what you make of it.
I like your attitude, but it can be risky.
I don't want you to get hurt.
He can't hurt me if he's dead.
She sprung her brother all by herself and this is what happened.
I told him about Jake and the little boy. He went off after Emmett.
Stop crying. Get Doc Skinner and bring him to the shed.
I've got a place to hide her.
You better get in there with her until this thing is over.
They took him at your sister's house.
Her husband was shot. I don't know if he's gonna make it.
They took the little boy with them.
Get Kyle and Dusty over here.
He was trying to get away...
and he fell off his horse, off a cliff.
It never should've got this far, Cobb.
This is as far as it's goin'.
but you better watch your ass.
These guys will shoot it off.
It used to be a peaceful town.
See if you can find Rae.
You wait till we get back.
Last one to the Midnight Star buys.
You're going to be all right.
I'll stay with you until your little friend comes back.
Jake's in town! Let's start the ball!
I'm glad you're here. I've been watching her, but she needs a doctor.
This could've been such a sweet deal for us.
You take care of yourself, you hear?
Weren't you gonna come out and say goodbye?
You might make a farmer yet.
